description: This is my kind of game, I can sit and puzzle it out and really get into the theme. Yes!
Co-op / Solo
Includes Crewmen Deck I, Sailor Character Sheet, Searching the Beach Deck

title: It's reall...
description: It's really a thing of wonder to realize the amount of effort the designer have put into this game. There are so many rules, but they all connect and make sense with the theme. The game is super hard and that is what makes me want to come back for more.

title: Designer: ...
description: Designer: Ignacy Trzewiczek (Imperial Settlers)Publisher: Portal GamesPlayer count: 1-4 (best with 3)Weight: Medium heavyMechanics: adventure / cooperative / worker placementSetting/theme: Adventure / exploring / fightingPlay time: 90-180 minutesBased on run through and two solo games. This game breathes theme and I am very excited about this game. The game is brutal and if the cards are against you, you're unlikely to win this one, but that makes perfect sense in such a brutal environment. Would love to play this more and to introduce this to other players, but the complexity and the length make it hard to get this to the table except solo.Still, a definite keeper in my collection and if it would get more playtime likely to be in my top 10.

title: My wife sa...
description: My wife says there is too much Alpha-gaming in RC and others say the game is punishing and brutal. There can be alpha gaming or quarterbacking and the game is certainly harsh, brutal, and unforgiving, but I love it!

title: Very-very ...
description: Very-very good co-op with awsome theme. Gameplay elements are basicly worker-placement euro but we've been playing the events 'on suspense' (we're not reading whats going to happen when it comes back out from the action-deck. And it gives awsome story. If there wouldn't be Sentinels of the Multiverse I'd call it best co-op atm, but atm its kinda torn...

title: No Review Title
description: No Review Description

title: Only compl...
description:
Only completed the starting scenario. I did not appreciate the fiddly setup and confusing rulebook of the original edition and it was still a great experience! Very excited to try the updated version.

*Upgraded to latest edition with better components*

title: A good sys...
description: A good system and fun, but not worth the complexity. It is also a game that I do not want to teach.

title: Very thema...
description: Very thematic co-op. I really enjoy this game but set up time and little rules keep me from playing it more.

title: I'm convin...
description:
I'm convinced there's a fun game in here...
Rule book is unfortunately, terrible. Mechanics get totally in the way of the flow until you know exactly how it goes.  We house rule everything that comes up and research it later, otherwise you're stopping all the time, until you know it all cold.  Tough scenarios - seemingly great replayability. Wife will not play under any circumstances, haha.

Update - 6 months in.  Definitely enjoy it, now that the mechanics are second nature.  Love the replay value and the unpredictability.  Winning always feels like an accomplishment.

title: Hm. A few ...
description: Hm. A few plays in, and I still can't tell why this is significantly better than the hordes of competing co-ops. It's chromier, certainly, but at the expense of the tension and meaningful choices that Pandemic offers.

title: I played t...
description: I played this with 3 players and really didn't like it. But it's supposed to be an amazing solo game so it deserves another try.

title: also have ...
description:
also have dice tower exclusive promo set

pre-ordered from Miniature Market

title: Story, sto...
description: Story, story, story, story, story. This is about the story, and this does it better than any other game of its kind. Absolutely brilliant.

title: Ignacy's ...
description: Ignacy's magnum opus. The only co-op game I truly enjoy.

title: Fiddly set...
description: Fiddly setup (for which the Daedalus insert did not help) plus capricious difficulty didn't pay off for us. Ended up feeling more like a "create your own narrative" game than a "positively affect your destiny" game.

title: Just not a...
description: Just not a fun game.

title: One of the...
description: One of the best co-ops out there. I love the fact that the dice rolling suppresses the alpha-player effect (if you have someone like that in your group). Very challenging but not unbeatable, which makes it so satisfying when you do succeed on the scenario.

title: on my self...
description: on my self of shame. Has to bring a friend to carry me though rules the first game, we won!

title: Game is in...
description: Game is in Plano containers, scenarios sheets are laminated

title: While a ve...
description: While a very thematic mechanically sound game, there are times where randomness can quickly end whatever efforts you make to survive on the island. Very Unique, but not for those that aren't willing to leave some of their fate up to chance.

title: One of the...
description:
One of the better co-op games to come out this year (2013).
With the various scenarios providing lots of replay ability.
If you want a step-up from gateway co-op games and really like difficult, complex and thematic games then you get your money's worth from this.

dice tower secret trait cards - despair, a secret from the past, useful findings, faith, ostensible strength, hope for escape, illness, insecurity, dizziness

title: 1st editio...
description: 1st edition. Great art but components feel like they were stolen from random 10 year old games. Gameplay is complex, if not fiddly. Some very very cool concepts like the negative events being shuffled back the event deck so they can occur later. Looking forward to more plays and raising this rating.

title: Great inte...
description: Great integration of a fun theme.  Scenarios are really interesting and varied.

title: Initial Ra...
description: Initial Rating, will update after more experience.

title: Portal 4th...
description: Portal 4th edition
